inspirational.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

inspirational.text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

inspirational.text: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

inspirational.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
inspirational.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

inspirational.text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
inspirational.author: Aristotle

inspirational.text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
inspirational.author: Steve Jobs

inspirational.text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
inspirational.author: Tony Robbins

inspirational.text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
inspirational.author: George Addair

inspirational.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
inspirational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

inspirational.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
inspirational.author: Buddha

inspirational.text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
inspirational.author: Albert Einstein

inspirational.text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
inspirational.author: Thomas Edison

inspirational.text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
inspirational.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

inspirational.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
inspirational.author: Chinese Proverb

inspirational.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
inspirational.author: Wayne Gretzky

inspirational.text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
inspirational.author: Henry Ford

inspirational.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
inspirational.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

inspirational.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
inspirational.author: Theodore Roosevelt

inspirational.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
inspirational.author: William James

inspirational.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
inspirational.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
wisdom.author: Lao Tzu

wisdom.text: He who knows others is wise; he who knows himself is enlightened.
wisdom.author: Lao Tzu

wisdom.text: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: by reflection, by imitation, and by experience.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
wisdom.author: Nelson Mandela

wisdom.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
wisdom.author: John Lennon

wisdom.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
wisdom.author: Walt Disney

wisdom.text: If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more.
wisdom.author: Oprah Winfrey

wisdom.text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
wisdom.author: Mae West

wisdom.text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

motivation.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
motivation.author: Sam Levenson

motivation.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
motivation.author: Mark Twain

motivation.text: It always seems impossible until it's done.
motivation.author: Nelson Mandela

motivation.text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
motivation.author: C.S. Lewis

motivation.text: The harder you work for something, the greater you'll feel when you achieve it.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.text: Don't limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
motivation.author: Unknown

motivation.text: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
motivation.author: Winston Churchill

motivation.text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
motivation.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

motivation.text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
motivation.author: Henry David Thoreau

motivation.text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
motivation.author: Zig Ziglar

motivation.text: Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think.
motivation.author: A.A. Milne

motivation.text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
motivation.author: Jimmy Dean

motivation.text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
motivation.author: Arthur Ashe

motivation.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
motivation.author: C.S. Lewis

motivation.text: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra.
motivation.author: Jimmy Johnson

life.text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
life.author: Confucius

life.text: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
life.author: Charles R. Swindoll

life.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
life.author: Dalai Lama

life.text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
life.author: Stephen King

life.text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
life.author: Helen Keller

life.text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
life.author: Thomas Edison

life.text: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
life.author: Marilyn Monroe

life.text: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
life.author: Helen Keller

life.text: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
life.author: Bertrand Russell

life.text: Life is short, and it is up to you to make it sweet.
life.author: Sarah Louise Delany

life.text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
life.author: Anaïs Nin

life.text: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
life.author: Oprah Winfrey

life.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
life.author: Oscar Wilde

life.text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
life.author: Albert Einstein

life.text: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
life.author: Mahatma Gandhi

humor.text: I'm not lazy, I'm on energy saving mode.
humor.author: Unknown

humor.text: I used to think I was indecisive, but now I'm not so sure.
humor.author: Unknown

humor.text: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
humor.author: Jim Carrey

humor.text: Light travels faster than sound. This is why some people appear bright until you hear them speak.
humor.author: Alan Dundes

humor.text: The elevator to success is out of order. You'll have to use the stairs, one step at a time.
humor.author: Joe Girard

humor.text: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
humor.author: A.A. Milne

humor.text: Age is something that doesn't matter, unless you are a cheese.
humor.author: Luis Buñuel

humor.text: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.
humor.author: Lily Tomlin

humor.text: The road to success is always under construction.
humor.author: Lily Tomlin

humor.text: I find television very educational. Every time someone turns it on, I go read a book.
humor.author: Groucho Marx

mindfulness.text: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
mindfulness.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

mindfulness.text: Mindfulness is a way of befriending ourselves and our experience.
mindfulness.author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

mindfulness.text: In today's rush, we all think too much, seek too much, want too much, and forget about the joy of just being.
mindfulness.author: Eckhart Tolle

mindfulness.text: The mind is like water. When it's turbulent, it's difficult to see. When it's calm, everything becomes clear.
mindfulness.author: Prasad Mahes

mindfulness.text: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you.
mindfulness.author: Anne Lamott

mindfulness.text: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor.
mindfulness.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

mindfulness.text: Be where you are, not where you think you should be.
mindfulness.author: Unknown

mindfulness.text: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.
mindfulness.author: William James

mindfulness.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
mindfulness.author: Buddha

creativity.text: The chief enemy of creativity is good sense.
creativity.author: Pablo Picasso

creativity.text: You can't use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
creativity.author: Maya Angelou

creativity.text: The desire to create is one of the deepest yearnings of the human soul.
creativity.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

creativity.text: Creativity is contagious, pass it on.
creativity.author: Albert Einstein

creativity.text: Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.
creativity.author: Edgar Degas

creativity.text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.
creativity.author: Pablo Picasso

creativity.text: Imagination is the beginning of creation.
creativity.author: George Bernard Shaw

creativity.text: The creative adult is the child who survived.
creativity.author: Ursula K. Le Guin

perseverance.text: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
perseverance.author: Confucius

perseverance.text: It's not that I'm so smart, it's just that I stay with problems longer.
perseverance.author: Albert Einstein

perseverance.text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
perseverance.author: Japanese Proverb

perseverance.text: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
perseverance.author: Walter Elliot

perseverance.text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
perseverance.author: Confucius

perseverance.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
perseverance.author: Winston Churchill

perseverance.text: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
perseverance.author: A.A. Milne

perseverance.text: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.
perseverance.author: Napoleon Hill

perseverance.text: A river cuts through rock, not because of its power, but because of its persistence.
perseverance.author: Jim Watkins

perseverance.text: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
perseverance.author: Benjamin Franklin
